one_sentence_summary: This gene shows dramatically elevated expression (20-25 fold increase) across all enteroepithelial stages (EES1-EES5) compared to tachyzoites and tissue cysts, indicating strong upregulation during sexual development in the feline intestinal environment.
notes: Expression values range from ~100-1100 TPM in asexual stages to ~2600-2800 TPM in all enteroepithelial stages, with consistently high percentile rankings (>99th percentile) during sexual development, suggesting this gene is critical for the sexual phase of the parasite life cycle.
experiment_name: Feline enterocyte, tachyzoite, bradyzoite stage transcriptome

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows markedly elevated expression in enteroepithelial stages (EES1-5) with TPM values of ~2,500-2,800, moderately high expression in tachyzoites (~1,100 TPM), and dramatically lower expression in all oocyst stages (unsporulated, sporulating, and sporulated) with TPM values below 36.
notes: The expression pattern suggests this gene is highly stage-specific, being most critical during enteroepithelial development and tachyzoite stages, with minimal role during oocyst development and sporulation. The >70-fold difference between highest and lowest expressing stages indicates strong biological regulation.
experiment_name: Full life-cycle transcriptome of T. gondii

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows very high expression in the sense orientation (630-1118 TPM, 97th-98th percentile) with peak expression at 16 hours post-infection, while antisense expression remains consistently low (3-12 TPM, 84th-94th percentile) throughout the T. gondii tachyzoite time course.
notes: The dramatic difference between sense and antisense expression (>100-fold) and consistently high percentile rankings suggest this is a highly expressed, potentially important gene during tachyzoite development.
experiment_name: Tachyzoite Transcriptome Time Series (VEG)

one_sentence_summary: This gene exhibits strong periodic expression during the Toxoplasma gondii cell cycle, with peak expression at hours 0-1 and 7-8 post-thymidine synchronization, dropping to minimum levels around hours 3-4, indicating cell cycle-regulated transcription.
notes: Expression shows clear biphasic pattern with ~6-hour periodicity and high percentile values (96-99th) throughout, suggesting this is a highly expressed, cell cycle-regulated gene. The spline-smoothed data confirms the cyclical pattern observed in the raw measurements.
experiment_name: Cell Cycle Expression Profiles (RH)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows highest expression in Toxoplasma gondii tachyzoites (2 days in vitro), with moderate expression in mature bradyzoites and sporulated oocysts, and lowest expression in unsporulated oocysts and in vivo bradyzoites.
notes: Clear stage-specific expression pattern with >6-fold difference between highest (tachyzoite) and lowest (unsporulated oocyst) expression; notable difference between in vitro and in vivo bradyzoites suggests environmental influence on expression.
experiment_name: Oocyst, tachyzoite, and bradyzoite developmental expression profiles (M4)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows strong upregulation in Toxoplasma gondii merozoites compared to tachyzoites, with expression levels consistently elevated across all three cat-derived merozoite samples (RMA values ~13.5-13.7) relative to the tachyzoite control (RMA value 11.1).
notes: The ~2.5-fold increase in expression (based on log2 values) and consistently high percentile rankings (98-99th percentile) in merozoites versus 95th percentile in tachyzoites suggests this gene may play an important role in merozoite-specific functions during the sexual cycle in the feline host.
experiment_name: Merozoite Gene Expression

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression throughout the T. gondii tachyzoite infection time course with TPM values ranging from 532-1077, peaking at 36 hours post-infection, and exhibits negligible antisense transcription.
notes: High percentile rankings (96-98th percentile) indicate this is among the most highly expressed genes in the parasite transcriptome during infection; the slight peak at 36 hours may suggest enhanced expression during late tachyzoite development.
experiment_name: Tachyzoite Transcriptome Time Series (ME49)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows high expression in T. gondii tachyzoites with peak levels at 22 hours post-infection (1723.32 TPM, 98.87th percentile), followed by moderate expression at 2 hours (952.56 TPM, 97.95th percentile) and lower expression at 36 hours (609.88 TPM, 96.7th percentile), indicating temporal regulation during the parasite life cycle.
notes: The gene shows consistently high percentile rankings (96-99th percentile) across all timepoints, suggesting it is among the most highly expressed genes throughout the infection process. Antisense expression is negligible, indicating proper strand-specific detection.
experiment_name: Tachyzoite Transcriptome Time Series (RH)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression throughout the 16-hour time course in T. gondii GT1 tachyzoites with transcript levels ranging from ~750-1,231 TPM and ranking in the 97th-98th percentile among all genes.
notes: Gene shows constitutively high expression with no clear temporal regulation pattern; antisense transcription is absent, indicating unidirectional expression.
experiment_name: Tachyzoite Transcriptome Time Series (GT1)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows high expression in Toxoplasma gondii bradyzoites with 337.37 TPM on the sense strand, ranking in the 94th percentile compared to all genes in this experiment.
notes: Strong sense strand expression with minimal antisense signal suggests proper gene annotation and active transcription; high percentile ranking indicates this gene is among the most highly expressed in bradyzoites
experiment_name: Bradyzoite in vitro Transcriptome (ME49)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows strong upregulation during Toxoplasma gondii oocyst maturation, with expression levels increasing dramatically from 0.88 TPM at day 0 to 63.04 TPM at day 10 post-sporulation.
notes: Expression shows clear temporal progression with >70-fold increase over 10 days, suggesting important role in oocyst development; antisense expression remains minimal throughout, indicating strand-specific regulation
experiment_name: Oocyst Time Series (M4)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows substantially higher expression in intracellular versus extracellular Toxoplasma gondii parasites, with approximately 1.8-fold higher RNA levels and 4.3-fold higher ribosome-protected fragment levels inside host cells.
notes: The gene shows consistently high percentile rankings (97-99th percentile) across conditions, indicating it is among the most highly expressed genes in the parasite transcriptome. The much higher ribosome-seq signal relative to RNA-seq in the extracellular condition suggests potential translational regulation.
experiment_name: Comparative ribosome profiling of intracellular and extracellular parasites

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows high expression across most cell types during T. gondii infection, with substantially lower expression in fibroblasts (36.29 TPM) compared to neurons, astrocytes, and skeletal muscle cells (271-388 TPM).
notes: The gene shows consistently high percentile rankings (95-97th percentile) across all cell types, indicating it is among the most highly expressed genes in this experiment. The 7-11 fold lower expression in fibroblasts suggests potential host cell-dependent regulation.
experiment_name: T gondii Transcriptome during infection in 4 mouse cell types

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows substantial downregulation in Toxoplasma gondii during chronic infection (28 days) compared to acute infection (10 days), with expression decreasing approximately 5-fold from 429.32 to 86.7 TPM.
notes: High percentile rankings (96.96% acute, 79.99% chronic) indicate this gene is highly expressed relative to other parasite genes in both conditions, suggesting it plays an important role throughout infection but is particularly critical during acute phase.
experiment_name: Transcriptome during acute or chronic infection in mouse brain

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently very high expression in Toxoplasma gondii tachyzoites with a slight increase from day 3 to day 4 post-infection (960-1044 TPM), ranking in the 98th percentile of all genes.
notes: Expression levels are exceptionally high (>950 TPM) and consistently rank in 98th percentile, suggesting this is a highly abundant transcript. The temporal increase is modest but consistent across unique and total read counts.
experiment_name: Tachyzoite Transcriptome 3 and 4 days post-infection (VEG NcLIV)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows dramatically higher expression in Toxoplasma gondii tachyzoites (748-813 TPM, 98th percentile) compared to sporozoites (67 TPM, 91st percentile) and is completely absent in frozen sporozoite controls.
notes: The gene appears to be strongly stage-specific, being highly expressed in the asexual tachyzoite stage but much lower in the sexual sporozoite stage, suggesting potential roles in tachyzoite-specific processes like rapid replication or acute infection.
experiment_name: T. gondii during infection in IEC18 cells (Dual RNA-Seq)

one_sentence_summary: This Toxoplasma gondii gene shows markedly higher expression in Type III strain-infected neurons (279.52 TPM, 95.76th percentile) compared to Type II strain-infected neurons (61.1 TPM, 84.24th percentile), with minimal expression in bystander neurons from both strains.
notes: The large standard errors relative to mean values suggest high variability between replicates, but the strain-specific expression pattern and high percentile rankings support biological significance of the differential expression.
experiment_name: Parasite transcriptome during infection in mouse brain.

one_sentence_summary: This gene is significantly downregulated in Toxoplasma gondii bradyzoites compared to tachyzoites, showing approximately 2-fold lower expression (307 vs 594 TPM) during the chronic stage differentiation.
notes: Both life stages show very high expression levels (>90th percentile), suggesting this is an abundantly expressed gene that becomes downregulated but remains highly active during bradyzoite formation.
experiment_name: Stage-specific RNA-sequencing in Toxoplasma gondii

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows high expression in tachyzoites and early infection stages (days 1-2) that dramatically decreases by day 4 and remains low through day 14, while antisense transcription increases over time during Toxoplasma gondii differentiation in rat brain cells.
notes: Clear temporal pattern suggests involvement in tachyzoite-to-bradyzoite conversion; inverse relationship between sense and antisense expression may indicate regulatory mechanism during stage differentiation.
experiment_name: T. gondii during spontaneous differentiation in primary rat brain cells.

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows moderate differential expression across T. gondii lineages, with highest expression in Type I strains (RH: 9.17, GT1: 8.31) compared to Type II (Pru: 7.14, ME49: 8.02) and Type III (CTG: 8.22, VEG: 7.69) strains.
notes: The gene shows consistent Type I > Type III > Type II expression pattern when comparing lineage averages, with all expression values in the 88-94th percentile range indicating generally high expression across all strains.
experiment_name: Expression profiling of 3 archetypal lineages

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows high expression across all conditions in Toxoplasma gondii tachyzoites, with a notable transient decrease immediately after invasion (10.31) compared to extracellular parasites (11.29) and 2-hour post-invasion parasites (11.83).
notes: Gene shows consistently high percentile rankings (95-98%) indicating it is among the most highly expressed genes in the parasite transcriptome; the invasion-associated dip and recovery pattern suggests potential regulation during host cell entry.
experiment_name: Tachyzoite transcriptome during invasion (RH)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression throughout Toxoplasma gondii bradyzoite differentiation with RMA values typically ranging from 8-11 (log2 scale) and percentiles consistently above 80%, indicating sustained upregulation without major temporal changes during the transition from tachyzoites to bradyzoites.
notes: Gene maintains high expression levels (80-98th percentiles) throughout the differentiation process, suggesting it may be important for both tachyzoite and bradyzoite life stages rather than being specifically regulated during the transition.
experiment_name: Bradyzoite Differentiation (Multiple 6-hr time points and Extended time series)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression across all Toxoplasma gondii strains and conditions, with modest but consistent downregulation during bradyzoite differentiation induced by both Compound 1 and pH 8.2 treatments.
notes: Expression remains in the 95th-97th percentile across all conditions, suggesting this is a highly expressed gene that may have constitutive functions but shows some sensitivity to differentiation signals.
experiment_name: Bradyzoite Differentiation Expression Profiles (ME49, GT1, CTGara)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows a steady downregulation during Toxoplasma gondii bradyzoite differentiation, with expression decreasing from 12.49 to 11.61 log2 units over 4 days while maintaining very high percentile rankings (97.98% to 96%).
notes: Despite the downregulation, this gene remains highly expressed relative to the genome (>96th percentile throughout), suggesting it may be important for both life stages but with diminishing requirements during bradyzoite formation.
experiment_name: Bradyzoite Differentiation (3-day time series)(Pru)

one_sentence_summary: This gene is highly expressed in both T. gondii life cycle stages but shows significantly higher expression in merozoites (1337 TPM) compared to tachyzoites (899 TPM), representing a 1.5-fold upregulation in the merozoite stage.
notes: Gene shows very high expression levels in both stages (>95th percentile) with low antisense transcription, suggesting it is important for both life cycle stages but particularly enhanced in merozoites. Standard errors are relatively small, indicating robust measurement.
experiment_name: Tachyzoite and merozoite transcriptomes

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows moderate expression in Toxoplasma gondii bradyzoites with higher antisense transcript levels (10.28 TPM, 96.6th percentile) compared to sense transcripts (6.19 TPM, 31.17th percentile).
notes: The high antisense expression (96.6th percentile) suggests potential antisense regulation of this gene during bradyzoite stage, which warrants further investigation of regulatory mechanisms.
experiment_name: Bradyzoite in vivo transcriptome (M4)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression across all 29 Toxoplasma gondii strains during macrophage infection, with transcript levels ranging from ~312 to 1,669 TPM and percentile rankings consistently above the 94th percentile, indicating constitutive high-level expression with modest strain-to-strain variation.
notes: The gene shows approximately 5-fold variation between strains (B41 lowest at ~312 TPM, TgCATBr9 highest at ~1,669 TPM), but maintains high percentile rankings across all strains, suggesting it is an important housekeeping or virulence gene with strain-specific expression levels.
experiment_name: Transcriptomes of 29 strains during murine macrophage infection

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows dose-dependent downregulation in response to tartrolon E treatment in Toxoplasma gondii, with expression decreasing from ~965-999 TPM in controls to ~447-485 TPM at the highest dose (24.2 nM) and intermediate levels (~877-1007 TPM) at the lower dose (6 nM).
notes: The gene shows consistently high expression (>97th percentile) across all conditions, suggesting it encodes an abundant transcript. The dose-dependent response is most apparent at 4 hours post-treatment, with the effect maintaining through 12 hours at the high dose.
experiment_name: RNA-seq of tartrolon E-treated T. gondii RH parasites

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows high expression levels (735-1,247 TPM) in the sense direction with a transient increase at 7 hours following CPSF4 knockdown in Toxoplasma gondii, followed by a decline to below baseline levels by 48 hours.
notes: The gene maintains consistently high expression (>97th percentile) throughout the time course, with antisense expression remaining very low (<4 TPM). The temporal pattern suggests potential regulatory relationship with CPSF4 function.
experiment_name: RNA-Seq of CPSF4 WT and CPSF4 KD parasites

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression across all conditions with modest upregulation in the GRA18 complemented strain compared to wild-type and GRA18 knockout strains, with no substantial effect from LPS treatment.
notes: Expression levels are consistently high (750-882 TPM, >97th percentile) across all conditions. The complemented strain shows ~15% higher expression than wild-type and knockout strains, suggesting potential GRA18-dependent regulation, though the effect is modest.
experiment_name: Transcriptome of Wild-Type and gra18 mutant strains of T. gondii

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression (>1400 TPM) across all conditions in Toxoplasma gondii, with modest increases upon FR235222 treatment and a notable decrease after 48 hours of IAA treatment in the PRU MORC KD strain.
notes: High baseline expression (98th percentile) suggests this is a constitutively expressed gene; the 48hr timepoint shows the most substantial change but still maintains relatively high expression levels.
experiment_name: RNA-Seq of MORC WT and MORC KD parasites

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows moderate expression in Toxoplasma gondii bradyzoites with a notable peak at 90 days post-infection (137.7 TPM) compared to 28 and 120 days (~114-115 TPM), suggesting transient upregulation during the intermediate chronic infection stage.
notes: The gene shows consistent high percentile rankings (81-84th percentile) across all timepoints, indicating it is generally highly expressed relative to other genes, with the 90-day peak representing a modest but potentially meaningful increase during chronic infection development.
experiment_name: Mouse brain bradyzoite transcriptomes at 28, 90, 120 days post infection

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression across all conditions in Toxoplasma gondii, with minimal variation between tachyzoite and bradyzoite stages or among differentiation mutants, suggesting constitutive expression that is largely unaffected by life cycle stage transitions or insertional mutations.
notes: Expression values are consistently high (12.56-13.53 log2) with >96th percentile rankings across all conditions, indicating this is likely a highly expressed housekeeping gene with minimal regulatory response to differentiation signals or genetic perturbations.
experiment_name: Mutants and wild-type expression profiles during bradyzoite differentiation

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows minimal differential expression in response to alkaline stress in Toxoplasma gondii, with only a slight increase under stress conditions in both wild-type and GCN5-A knockout strains.
notes: Expression values are consistently high (>96th percentile) across all conditions, but the magnitude of change is very small (0.1-0.26 log2 units), suggesting this gene may be constitutively expressed rather than stress-responsive.
experiment_name: Differential Expression Profiling GCN5-A mutant

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows minimal differential expression across wild-type, PRMT1 knockout, and complement strains in Toxoplasma gondii, with only modest upregulation (0.39 log2 units) in the PRMT1 knockout compared to wild-type.
notes: All samples show very high expression levels (>96th percentile) with small standard errors, suggesting this is a highly expressed gene with minimal response to PRMT1 deletion.
experiment_name: PMRT1 KO, WT and KOCM expression profiles
